kihkct2lText: MADRS PDQ DSST SDS UPSA EEfRT MEI ODQ GAS-DSHAPS
kihkct2mText: SHAPS - Snaith–Hamilton Pleasure Scale1
kihkct2nText:
SHAPS is a 14-item, self-reported scale evaluating anhedonia for neuropsychiatric
disorders; Higher scores indicate higher severity
kihkct2oText:
I would enjoy my favourite television or
radio programme
kihkct2pText:
I would enjoy being with family or close
friends
kihkct2qText:
I would find pleasure in my hobbies and
pastimes
kihkct2rText:
I would be able to enjoy my favourite
meal
kihkct2sText:
I would enjoy a warm bath or refreshing
shower
kihkct2tText:
I would find pleasure in the scent of
flowers or the smell of a fresh sea breeze
or freshly baked bread
kihkct2uText:
I would enjoy seeing other people’s
smiling faces
kihkct2vText:
I would enjoy looking smart when I have
made an effort with my appearance
kihkct2wText:
I would enjoy reading a book, magazine
or newspaper
kihkct2xText:
I would enjoy a cup of tea or coffee, or
my favourite drink
kihkct2yText:
I would find pleasure in small things,
e.g. bright sunny day, a telephone call
from a friend
kihkct2zText:
I would be able to enjoy a beautiful
landscape or view
kihkct30Text:
I would get pleasure from helping
others
kihkct31Text:
I would feel pleasure when I receive
praise from other people
Brintellix_151af810b2: <font style="font-size: 15px; font-family: '3_BNJCUB+AvenirNextLTPro-Regular';color: rgb(100, 94, 94);">Snaith RP et al. Br J Psychiatry 1995;167:99-103.</font>
